Description: Shoulder and handle sherd of East Greek, possibly Aeolian, grey ware pottery vessel, probably a krater; interior: reserved; exterior: very worn dark grey slip; triple horizontal grooves between handle roots; relief decoration of part of tendril emerging from handle join, no doubt once ending in a raised disc.
Curator's comments: The fabric and decorative techinques find parallels with British Museum 1888,0601.644.c. This sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.122)
